definition: unheard-of/unprecedented
front/forward/ahead/first/top (followed by a number)/future/ago/before/BC (e.g. 前293年)/former/formerly
actually/place/classifier for houses, small buildings, institutions etc/that which/particle introducing a relative clause or passive/CL:個|个[ge4]
not yet/did not/have not/not/8th earthly branch: 1-3 p.m., 6th solar month (7th July-6th August), year of the Sheep/ancient Chinese compass point: 210°
to hear/news/well-known/famous/reputation/fame/to smell/to sniff at
surname Wen

sentences.english: That is absolutely unprecedented in American science.
sentences.chinese: 这在美国科学史上绝对是前所未闻的。

sentences.english: And an unprecedented controversy broke forth. Each struggled to determine which should not allow himself to be placed at the door of the tomb.
sentences.chinese: 一场前所未闻的争辩展开了，就看谁不被人赶出墓门。

sentences.english: We are developing our production at a speed unheard-of before.
sentences.chinese: 我们正以前所未闻的速度发展生产。

sentences.english: And it came in on time, which is pretty much unheard of.
sentences.chinese: 另外它总是准时，这是几乎前所未闻的。

sentences.english: "It was the most bizarre hoax we've ever had, " Chu said.
sentences.chinese: “这样的古怪骗局实在是前所未闻，”朱说。

definition: unheard of/an extremely rare and unprecedented event
unimaginable/outrageous/freakish
unprecedented/never seen before
absolutely ridiculous (idiom); preposterous/the height of folly
shocking/horrifying/atrocious/terrible
never before in the whole of history (idiom)/unprecedented
marvel
turned out other than expected (idiom); unexpected
sth else/a separate matter/not the same thing/with different jobs (not colleagues)/a remarkable thing/sth special/an odd thing/sth strange or incomprehensible
tongue-tied/unable to speak (out of surprise, embarrassment etc)
unprecedented and never to be duplicated/the first and the last/unmatched/unique
to be the most ridiculous thing in the world (idiom)
pinyin: hua2 tian1 xia4 zhi1 da4 ji1

definition: (idiom) to gasp in amazement/to acclaim as the peak of perfection
anecdote/fantastic story
to exceed all expectations/to come as a surprise
stupefied/flabbergasted
